subject: AI & Agents
title: Plan-Then-Act vs ReAct
description: A 60-second lesson on Plan-Then-Act vs ReAct.

hook.text: Should your agent write a plan first, or decide step-by-step on the fly?

buildup.text: Plan-first is stable. Step-by-step is flexible but can wander.

discovery.text: Use plan-first for long workflows; use ReAct for messy, interactive tasks.

twist.text: Hybrid works: make a rough plan, then re-plan after each tool result.

climax.text: Pick the smallest method that achieves reliability at your latency budget.

punchline.text: Planning is a knob, not a religion.
